definition[0]: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together
example[0]: Certain combinations of sounds are not possible in English.
example[1]: A combination of factors may be responsible for the increase in cancer.
example[2]: A combination of tact and authority was needed to deal with the situation.
example[3]: Some drugs which are safe when taken separately are lethal in combination.
definition[1]: the series of numbers or letters you need to open a combination lock
definition[2]: used before a noun to mean that something has more than one purpose or uses more than one method
definition[3]: when two or more companies join together in a MERGER, takeover, or other financial arrangement affecting their ownership
